description: Explore structures, materials, and infrastructure design

slides.title: Welcome to Civil Engineering
slides.content:
# Introduction to Civil Engineering

Welcome to **Civil Engineering** - building infrastructure!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Structures** - Buildings and bridges
- **Materials** - Concrete, steel, etc.
- **Geotechnical** - Foundations and soil
- **Transportation** - Roads and systems
- **Water Resources** - Dams and supply

> **Fun Fact:** The pyramids of Egypt are civil engineering marvels over 4,500 years old!

slides.title: Types of Loads
slides.content:
# Types of Loads

## Structural Loads:

| Load Type | Description | Examples |
|-----------|------------|----------|
| Dead load | Permanent (structure weight) | Walls, floors, roof |
| Live load | Variable (temporary) | People, furniture |
| Wind load | Horizontal pressure | Storms |
| Seismic | Earthquake forces | Ground motion |
| Snow load | Seasonal | Winter accumulation |
| Impact | Dynamic | Vehicle collision |

## Load Combinations:
- Design considers multiple loads
- Safety factors applied
- Building codes specify requirements

slides.title: Structural Elements
slides.content:
# Structural Elements

## Main Components:

| Element | Function | Forces |
|---------|----------|--------|
| Beams | Horizontal spanning | Bending, shear |
| Columns | Vertical support | Compression |
| Trusses | Triangular frameworks | Tension, compression |
| Slabs | Horizontal surfaces | Bending |
| Arches | Curved spanning | Compression |
| Cables | Suspension | Tension |

## Structural Systems:
- Frame structures
- Shell structures
- Tensile structures
- Hybrid systems

slides.title: Concrete
slides.content:
# Concrete

## Composition:
- Cement (10-15%)
- Water (15-20%)
- Fine aggregate - sand (25-30%)
- Coite aggregate - gravel (40-50%)

## Properties:
- Compressive strength: 20-50 MPa typical
- Weak in tension
- Durable, fire-resistant
- Moldable when fresh

## Types:
| Type | Use |
|------|-----|
| Plain | Non-structural |
| Reinforced | Structural (with steel) |
| Prestressed | Long spans |
| High-performance | Special applications |

slides.title: Steel Construction
slides.content:
# Steel Construction

## Properties:
- High strength-to-weight ratio
- Ductile (bends before breaking)
- Yield strength: 250-400 MPa
- Uniform, predictable

## Structural Shapes:
- I-beams (W-shapes)
- Channels (C-shapes)
- Angles (L-shapes)
- Tubes (hollow sections)

## Connections:
| Type | Advantages |
|------|------------|
| Bolted | Easy to assemble |
| Welded | Strong, rigid |
| Riveted | Historical |

## Applications:
- High-rise buildings
- Long-span bridges
- Industrial structures

slides.title: Other Materials
slides.content:
# Other Construction Materials

## Timber:
- Renewable, sustainable
- Good strength-to-weight
- Vulnerable to moisture, fire
- Cross-laminated timber (CLT) is growing

## Masonry:
- Bricks, blocks, stone
- Durable, fire-resistant
- Good in compression
- Heavy

## Composites:
- Fiber-reinforced polymers (FRP)
- High strength, lightweight
- Corrosion resistant
- Carbon fiber, fiberglass

## Sustainability:
- Recycled materials
- Low-carbon concrete
- Life-cycle assessment

slides.title: Beam and Column Design
slides.content:
# Beam and Column Design

## Beam Design:
- Calculate bending moment (M)
- Calculate shear force (V)
- Select appropriate section
- Check deflection limits

## Column Design:
- Axial compression
- Buckling consideration
- Slenderness ratio: L/r
- Euler buckling formula

## Design Codes:
- ACI (concrete)
- AISC (steel)
- Eurocode
- Local building codes

## Safety Factors:
- Load factors (increase loads)
- Resistance factors (reduce capacity)

slides.title: Bridge Types
slides.content:
# Bridge Types

## Classification by Structure:

| Type | Span | Principle |
|------|------|----------|
| Beam/Girder | Short-Medium | Simple bending |
| Arch | Medium | Compression |
| Truss | Medium-Long | Triangles |
| Suspension | Very Long | Cables in tension |
| Cable-stayed | Long | Direct cables |
| Cantilever | Medium-Long | Balanced sections |

## Famous Examples:
- Golden Gate (suspension, 1280m)
- Sydney Harbour (arch, 503m)
- Millau Viaduct (cable-stayed, 2460m)
- Akashi Kaikyo (suspension, 1991m)

slides.title: Bridge Design
slides.content:
# Bridge Design Considerations

## Design Factors:
- Traffic loads
- Environmental conditions
- Span length
- Soil conditions
- Aesthetics
- Budget

## Components:
- Deck: Traffic surface
- Superstructure: Main spanning
- Substructure: Piers, abutments
- Foundation: Support in ground

## Analysis:
- Static analysis
- Dynamic (wind, earthquake)
- Fatigue considerations
- Long-term effects

slides.title: Geotechnical Engineering
slides.content:
# Geotechnical Engineering

## Soil Types:

| Type | Properties |
|------|------------|
| Clay | Fine, plastic, low permeability |
| Sand | Coarse, granular, high permeability |
| Silt | Medium, low plasticity |
| Gravel | Large particles, strong |
| Rock | Very strong, stable |

## Soil Properties:
- Bearing capacity
- Shear strength
- Compressibility
- Permeability

## Site Investigation:
- Boring and sampling
- Standard penetration test (SPT)
- Cone penetration test (CPT)

slides.title: Foundations
slides.content:
# Foundations

## Shallow Foundations:
- Spread footings
- Mat/raft foundations
- Combined footings
- Used when good soil is near surface

## Deep Foundations:
- Driven piles
- Drilled shafts
- Caissons
- Used when good soil is deep

## Selection Factors:
- Soil conditions
- Load magnitude
- Water table
- Adjacent structures
- Cost

## Settlement:
- Immediate settlement
- Consolidation (long-term)
- Differential settlement (problematic)

slides.title: Transportation Engineering
slides.content:
# Transportation Engineering

## Road Design:
- Geometric design (curves, grades)
- Pavement design
- Drainage
- Signage and markings

## Design Speed:
- Determines geometry
- Stopping sight distance
- Horizontal curves
- Vertical curves

## Pavement Types:
| Type | Materials |
|------|----------|
| Flexible | Asphalt layers |
| Rigid | Concrete slabs |
| Composite | Both |

## Traffic Engineering:
- Capacity analysis
- Signal timing
- Intersection design

slides.title: Water Resources
slides.content:
# Water Resources Engineering

## Components:
- Water supply systems
- Wastewater treatment
- Stormwater management
- Dams and reservoirs

## Hydraulics:
- Open channel flow
- Pipe flow
- Pumping systems

## Water Treatment:
- Coagulation/flocculation
- Sedimentation
- Filtration
- Disinfection

## Dams:
| Type | Material |
|------|----------|
| Gravity | Concrete |
| Arch | Concrete |
| Embankment | Earth, rock |
| Buttress | Concrete |

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Civil Engineering Summary

## Loads:
- Dead (permanent), Live (variable)
- Wind, Seismic, Snow

## Materials:
| Material | Strength |
|----------|----------|
| Concrete | Compression |
| Steel | Tension and compression |
| Timber | Variable |

## Bridge Types:
- Beam, Arch, Truss, Suspension, Cable-stayed

## Foundations:
- Shallow vs Deep
- Depends on soil and load

## Other Areas:
- Transportation
- Water resources
- Environmental

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Civil Engineering!
